001package imagingbook.lib.filter.linear;
002
003import imagingbook.lib.filter.GenericFilter;
004import imagingbook.lib.filter.GenericFilterScalarSeparable;
005import imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
006
007/**
008 * This class represents a 2D linear filter that is x/y-separable and
009 * specified by two 1D-kernels.
010 * It is based on {@link GenericFilter} and {@link GenericFilterScalarSeparable},
011 * which take care of all data copying and filter mechanics.
012 * Since it is a "scalar" filter, pixel values are treated as scalars.
013 * If the processed image has more than one component 
014 * (e.g., a RGB color image), this filter is automatically 
015 * and independently applied to all (scalar-valued) components.
016 * To apply to an image, use the {@link #applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor)}
017 * method, for example.
018 */
019public class LinearFilterSeparable extends GenericFilterScalarSeparable {
020
021        private final float[] hX, hY;                   // the horizontal/vertical kernel arrays
022        private final int width, height;                // width/height of the kernel
023        private final int xc, yc;                               // 'hot spot' coordinates
024        
025        /**
026         * Constructor, takes a 1D convolution kernel to be applied both
027         * in x- and y-direction. 
028         * 
029         * @param kernelXY a 1D convolution kernel
030         */
031        public LinearFilterSeparable(Kernel1D kernelXY) {
032                this(kernelXY, kernelXY);
033        }
034        
035        /**
036         * Constructor, takes two 1D convolution kernels to be applied
037         * in x- and y-direction, respectively
038         * 
039         * @param kernelX a 1D convolution kernel for the x-direction
040         * @param kernelY a 1D convolution kernel for the y-direction
041         */
042        public LinearFilterSeparable(Kernel1D kernelX, Kernel1D kernelY) {
043                super();
044                this.hX = kernelX.getH();
045                this.hY = kernelY.getH();
046                this.width = kernelX.getWidth();
047                this.height = kernelY.getWidth();
048                this.xc = kernelX.getXc();
049                this.yc = kernelY.getXc();
050        }
051
052        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
053
054        // 1D convolution in x-direction
055        @Override
056        protected float doPixelX(PixelSlice source, int u, int v) {
057                final int vj = v; // - yc;
058                double sum = 0;
059                for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
060                        int ui = u + i - xc;
061                        sum = sum + source.getVal(ui, vj) * hX[i];
062                }
063                return (float)sum;
064        }
065        
066        @Override
067        // 1D convolution in y-direction
068        protected float doPixelY(PixelSlice source, int u, int v) {
069                final int ui = u; // - xc;
070                double sum = 0;
071                for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
072                        int vj = v + j - yc;
073                        sum = sum + source.getVal(ui, vj) * hY[j];
074                }
075                return (float) sum;
076        }
077
078}
